meanings.definition: Containing or consisting of large, thick pieces
meanings.sent1: The soup was chunky with big vegetables.
meanings.sent2: She wore a chunky sweater to stay warm.
meanings.sent3: The chunky monkey tried to fit into a small box.
meanings.sent4: His chunky fingers struggled to pick up the tiny coin.
meanings.sent5: The chunky rocks in the river made it difficult to cross.

meanings.definition: Having a thick, solid appearance or texture
meanings.sent1: The mud was chunky and hard to walk through.
meanings.sent2: The old book had chunky pages that were difficult to turn.
meanings.sent3: The chunky pudding wobbled on the plate.
meanings.sent4: Her chunky necklace added a touch of elegance to her outfit.
meanings.sent5: The chunky clouds blocked out the sun, casting a shadow over the field.

meanings.definition: A thick, solid piece or mass
meanings.sent1: He took a chunky of cheese and took a big bite.
meanings.sent2: The artist sculpted a chunky of clay into a beautiful vase.
meanings.sent3: The chunky of ice cream fell off the cone and onto the ground.
meanings.sent4: She found a chunky of wood to use as a makeshift hammer.
meanings.sent5: The chef added a chunky of meat to the stew for extra flavor.
